messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] convincing yourself and relatives that unschooling's working
messages.msgSnippet: I also think this is a great idea and my son would really enjoy it.  My problem is I have no idea how to go about doing it?!  Does anyone have some suggestions
messages.messageBody:
I also think this is a great idea and my son would really enjoy it. My problem is I have no idea how to go about doing it?! Does anyone have some suggestions of how I would start it up? Thanks Kelli
Gerard Westenberg wrote:<< just had an idea!! Maybe keep a journal on a webpage, and if relatives are
nosy, give them the URL. Let that be the best of the activities and news of
your kids, AND you could put in good posts and links from online unschooling
discussions, >>

Wow, this is a really good idea and is something I could see my older kids really getting into! :-) Thanks..Leonie W.

messages.subject: convincing yourself and relatives that unschooling's working
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/26/02 8:21:33 PM, westen@bigpond.com.au writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/26/02 8:21:33 PM, westen@... writes:

<< .With closer family ( older kids? spouse?) I would feel free to journal
some of our days and/or moments (I do this anyway) and show it to them as an
example of how well unschooling is working...Leonie W. >>

I just had an idea!! Maybe keep a journal on a webpage, and if relatives are
nosy, give them the URL. Let that be the best of the activities and news of
your kids, AND you could put in good posts and links from online unschooling
discussions, and if they REALLY care, they can go there and read the updates.

Sandra
